name: Decult Talks - Breaking the Silence on Cultic Harm

episodes.title: The truth about The Truth: Secrets and cover-ups of the 2x2s
episodes.description: In this gripping episode of Decult Talks, Laura McConnell Conti shares her personal story of growing up in the secretive sect “The Truth” (or 2x2s), a group currently under investigation by the FBI for pedophilia. Laura takes us through her journey of leaving the cult, shedding light on the control tactics and the psychological impact of being raised within such a closed and abusive environment. Recorded live at the first Decult Conference in Christchurch, New Zealand and produced as a podcast by Plains Media . Tune in for a powerful and eye-opening discussion that will leave you reflecting on the far-reaching effects of cult influence. Stay connected with Decult! Follow us on ⁠ ⁠⁠Instagram⁠⁠ ⁠, ⁠ ⁠⁠Facebook⁠⁠ ⁠, ⁠⁠LinkedIn⁠⁠ , ⁠⁠Threads⁠⁠ and ⁠⁠⁠Bluesky⁠⁠⁠ , and visit our ⁠ ⁠⁠website⁠⁠ ⁠ to sign up for our newsletter. Be the first to know about our next conference in 2026 by ⁠⁠⁠preregistering⁠ now⁠⁠ , check out all the ⁠Decult 2024 highlights⁠, and stay tuned for our documentary! Decult is a small charity run by volunteers. You can help us immensely by supporting our work with a ⁠⁠⁠donation⁠⁠ ⁠. Thank you for your support!

episodes.title: Rabbit Hole Resistance: Cults, disinformation and online radicalisation
episodes.description: What is the overlap of disinformation, cults and online radicalisation? Stephen Judd from FACT Aotearoa leads a compelling panel discussion on Decult Talks, joined by experts in cult dynamics and extremism: Prof Ekant Veer (University of Canterbury), Austrian cult expert Ulrike Schiesser, Australian-Egyptian human rights activist Adam Elmasri and Auckland psychotherapist Paul Wilson. Together, they unpack the social and psychological forces that pull people into dangerous rabbit holes, offering insights into how individuals and societies are affected. Recorded live at the first Decult Conference in Christchurch, New Zealand, and produced as a podcast by Plains Media . Tune in for a deep dive into the intersection of cults and disinformation spreading. Stay connected with Decult! Follow us on ⁠ ⁠⁠Instagram⁠⁠ ⁠, ⁠ ⁠⁠Facebook⁠⁠ ⁠, ⁠⁠LinkedIn⁠⁠ , ⁠⁠Threads⁠⁠ and ⁠⁠⁠Bluesky⁠⁠⁠ , and visit our ⁠ ⁠⁠website⁠⁠ ⁠ to sign up for our newsletter. episodes.title: Toxic tantra: Surviving and suing MISA’s yoga guru with Bec Sonkkila
episodes.description: In this powerful episode of Decult Talks, Bec Sonkkila, a survivor of the esoteric tantra yoga school MISA, shares her incredible journey and the vital role she played in bringing their controversial guru, Gregorian Bivolaru, to justice. Bivolaru was arrested in 2023, and Bec’s courage and perseverance were instrumental in exposing the truth behind the Romanian cult that hides behind different names across Europe. This compelling presentation was recorded live at the first Decult Conference in Christchurch, New Zealand, and produced as a podcast by Plains Media⁠ . Tune in for an inspiring and eye-opening discussion about justice, healing and the fight against cult manipulation. Stay connected with Decult! Follow us on ⁠ ⁠⁠Instagram⁠⁠⁠ , ⁠ ⁠⁠Facebook⁠⁠ ⁠, ⁠⁠LinkedIn⁠⁠ , ⁠⁠Threads⁠⁠ and ⁠ ⁠⁠Bluesky⁠⁠⁠ , and visit our ⁠ ⁠⁠website⁠⁠⁠ to sign up for our newsletter. episodes.title: Bible study with a hook: Shincheonji’s recruitment with Laura Muir
episodes.description: In this eye-opening episode of Decult Talks, we hear from Laura Muir, a former member of the Korean Bible cult Shincheonji. Laura shares her personal experience and provides an in-depth look at the cult's recruitment tactics, shedding light on the psychological manipulation and strategies used to draw people in. This powerful presentation was recorded live at the first Decult Conference in Christchurch, New Zealand, and produced as a podcast by ⁠Plains Media⁠ . Tune in for a thought-provoking presentation that will challenge what you know about how cults operate in our communities. Stay connected with Decult! episodes.title: Kids in Cults: From damage and silence to justice and repair
episodes.description: Get ready for a powerful and thought-provoking conversation in this episode of Decult Talks. Hosted by journalist Adam Dudding, this dynamic panel discussion was recorded live at the first Decult Conference in Christchurch, New Zealand, and has been produced by ⁠Plains Media⁠ . Join Dr. Caroline Ansley from the Centrepoint Restoration Project, Maria Esguerra, a psychologist and Children of God survivor, Luke Hollis, a former Jehovah’s Witness, and Dr Janja Lalich, a leading US cult expert, as they delve deep into the personal and psychological impacts of cults on children born or raised in them. This conversation brings together powerful stories of survival, recovery, and expertise in the fight against coercion and manipulation. Don’t miss this eye-opening episode that will leave you with a new perspective on complex human rights and mental health issues. Tune in now for an unforgettable discussion that uncovers the truth behind cults. Stay connected with Decult! Follow us on ⁠ ⁠Instagram⁠⁠ , ⁠ ⁠Facebook⁠ ⁠, ⁠LinkedIn⁠ , ⁠Threads⁠ and ⁠ ⁠Bluesky⁠⁠ , and visit our ⁠ ⁠website⁠⁠ to sign up for our newsletter. Be the first to know about our ⁠next conference in 2026 by ⁠preregistering⁠ now⁠ , check out all the ⁠Decult 2024 highlights⁠, and stay tuned for our documentary! Decult is a small charity run by volunteers. You can help us immensely by ⁠supporting our work with a ⁠donation⁠⁠ . Thank you for your support!

episodes.title: "Cults 101: Influence and harm of high control groups” with Dr. Janja Lalich
episodes.description: Get ready for an eye-opening presentation by Dr. Janja Lalich, one of the world’s leading experts on cults and extremism and the author of “Take Back Your Life” and “Escaping Utopia”. As a Professor Emerita of Sociology and an international authority in her field, Dr. Lalich delivered the first keynote at the groundbreaking Decult Conference in Christchurch, New Zealand. Hosted by the insightful Andre Afamasaga, this episode explores Dr. Lalich’s “Bounded Choice” model and her fascinating insights into the psychological and social dynamics behind cults. Don’t miss this chance to hear from a true pioneer in the field. Tune in now for a powerful and thought-provoking talk that will leave you questioning everything you thought you knew about cults. Stay connected with Decult! Follow us on ⁠ Instagram ⁠, ⁠ Facebook ⁠, LinkedIn , Threads and ⁠Bluesky⁠ , and visit our ⁠ website ⁠ to sign up for our newsletter. Be the first to know about our next conference in 2026 by ⁠preregistering⁠ now , check out all the ⁠Decult 2024 highlights⁠, and stay tuned for our documentary!
